FastField.defaultValue: The DNS server could not signal the service "$15"
Error: $16
There may be interoperability problems between the DNS service and this service

FastPattern.description: ServiceWarning: The DNS server could not bind a TCP socket (eventId 404)

FastField.defaultValue: The DNS server could not bind a TCP socket to "$15"
Restart the DNS server or reboot the computer

FastPattern.description: ServiceWarning: The DNS server could not bind a UDP socket (eventId 407)

FastField.defaultValue: The DNS server could not bind a UDP socket to "$15"
Restart the DNS server or reboot the computer

FastPattern.description: ServiceWarning: The DNS server could not open socket (eventId 408)

FastField.defaultValue: The DNS server could not open socket for "$15"
Verify that this is a valid IP address for the server computer

FastPattern.description: server list contains unconfigured IP addresses (eventId 409)

FastField.defaultValue: For more information, see "To restrict a DNS server to listen only on selected addresses" in the online Help
Use the DNS manager server properties, interfaces dialog, to verify and reset the IP addresses the DNS server should listen on
The DNS server list of restricted interfaces contains IP addresses that are not configured for use at the server computer
In general, the DNS server should be reconfigured with a full DNS computer name appropriate for its domain or workgroup use on your network.

While the DNS server has only a single label name, default resource records created for its configured zones use only this single label name when mapping the host name for this DNS server. This can lead to incorrect and failed referrals when clients and other DNS servers use these records to locate this server by name
DNS Server currently has no primary DNS suffix configured

FastPattern.description: ServiceWarning: invalid or corrupted registry data (eventId 500)

FastField.defaultValue: The DNS server has detected that the zone "$15" has invalid or corrupted registry data
The DNS server has detected that the zone "$15" has invalid or corrupted registry data.

FastPattern.description: ServiceWarning: DNS unable to resolve username (eventId 503)

FastField.defaultValue: The DNS server has detected that the secondary zone "$15" has no master IP addresses in registry data
Add or update the IP address for the master server for this zone using the DNS console
Secondary zones require at least one master server to act as a source

FastPattern.description: ServiceWarning: invalid or corrupted registry parameter (eventId 506)

FastField.defaultValue: Invalid or corrupted registry parameter "$15"
To correct the problem, you can delete the applicable registry value, located under DNS server parameters in the Windows registry. You can then recreate it using the DNS console
DNS server will run as a caching-only server but will not be authoritative for any zones
DNS server did not detect any zones of either primary or secondary type
The zone will now be stored in the zone file "$16"
An administrator has changed the zone storage options for zone "$15"

FastPattern.description: ServiceInfo - new zone location in AD (eventId 713)

FastField.defaultValue: The zone will be stored in Active Directory at "$16"
An administrator has moved the zone "$15" to a new location in Active Diretory
The zone "$15" is configured to accept updates but the A record for the primary server in the zone's SOA record is not available on this DNS server. This may indicate a configuration problem.

If the address of the primary server for the zone cannot be resolved DNS clients will be unable to locate a server to accept updates for this zone. This will cause DNS clients to be unable to perform DNS updates.
Cycle time: $18 seconds , Next cycle in $19 hours , Error code: $20
Visited Nodes: $15, Scavenged Nodes: $16, Scavenged Records: $17
DNS Server has completed a scavenging cycle
Next cycle in $15 hours
DNS Server has completed a scavenging cycle but no nodes were visited
DNS Server Autoconfiguration Successful
Successful Configuration for: "$15", "$16", "$17", and "$18"

The DNS server is logging numerous run-time events. For information about these events, see previous DNS Server event log entries. To prevent the DNS Server from clogging server logs, further logging of this event and other events with higher Event IDs will now be suppressed.
DNS Server Suppressing Run-Time Events
DNS Server wrote version $15 of zone "$16" to file "$17"
DNS Server wrote version $15 of zone "$16" to file "$17"
Check that the Active Directory is functioning properly and reload the zone
This DNS server is configured to obtain and use information from the directory for this zone and is unable to load the zone without it
The DNS server was unable to open Active Directory
Check that the Active Directory is functioning properly and reload the zone
This DNS Server is configured to obtain and use information from the directory for this zone and is unable to load the zone without it
DNS server was unable to open zone "$15" in the Active Directory
This DNS server is configured to use information obtained from Active Directory for this zone and is unable to load the zone without it.
DNS Server $1
Zone deleted from Active Directory
Zone deleted from the DNS server also because it was an integrated zone

FastPattern.description: DNS unable to create name in memory (eventId 4006)

FastField.defaultValue: Unable to create name "$15" in memory for zone "$16"
Check if Active Directory is functioning properly and reload the zone
Directory name "$15" ignored
Unable to open zone "$15" partition "$16"
Check if Active Directory is functioning properly and reload the zone
DNS server configured to obtain information from directory for zone and unable to load zone without it
Unable to load Resource Record from directory "$15" zone "$16"
Use the DNS console to recreate this RR or check that the Active Directory is functioning properly and reload the zone
Check that the Active Directory is functioning properly and add or update this domain name using the DNS console
The DNS server was unable to add or write an update of domain name "$15" in zone "$16" to the Active Directory
The DNS server was unable to add or write an update of domain name to the Active Directory

FastPattern.description: Unable to open the Active Directory (eventId 4013)

FastField.defaultValue: The DNS server will wait for the directory to start. If the DNS server is started but the appropriate event has not been logged, then the DNS server is still waiting for the directory to start.
This DNS server is configured to use directory service information and can not operate without access to the directory
The DNS server was unable to open the Active Directory
Check that the Active Directory is functioning properly
The DNS server has encountered a critical error from the Active Directory
The DNS server has encountered a critical error from the Active Directory
Check Active Directory to see that it is functioning properly
The DNS server timed out attempting an Active Directory service operation on "$15"
The DNS server timed out attempting an Active Directory service operation
DNS server background load of Active Directory-integrated zone "$15" failed
Zone "$15" will now be shut down

FastPattern.description: DNS server not enlisted in replication scope (eventId 4513)

FastField.defaultValue: DNS server detected it is not enlisted in replication scope of the directory partition "$15"
Error: $17
This prevents the zones that should be replicated to all DNS servers in the "$16" forest from replicating to this DNS server
DNS server detected it is not enlisted in replication scope of the directory partition "$15"
Error: $17
This prevents the zones that should be replicated to all DNS servers in the "$16" domain from replicating to this DNS server
Zone "$15" was previously loaded from the directory partition DomainDnsZones "$16"
The DNS Server will ignore this new copy of the zone
Another copy of the zone has been found in directory partition ForestDnsZones "$17"
The DNS server will attempt to load this zone again on the next timeout cycle. This can be caused by high Active Directory load and may be a transient condition.
The DNS server encountered error $15 attempting to load zone "$16" from Active Directory
The DNS server encountered an error attempting to load zone from Active Directory
The DNS server encountered a bad packet from $15. Packet processing leads beyond packet length.
Rejected Invalid Packet from $15

FastPattern.description: DNS server received bad TCP packet (eventId 5502)

FastField.defaultValue: The packet was rejected or ignored
The DNS server received a bad TCP-based message from $15
The DNS server encountered an invalid domain name in a packet from $15. The packet was rejected.
Rejected Invalid DNS Domain Name Packet
The DNS server encountered an invalid domain name offset in a packet. The offset is the error (data: $15).
Encountered Invalid DNS Domain Name Offset
Encountered name offset exceeding the packet length
The offset is the error
The DNS server encountered an invalid DNS update message from $15. The packet was rejected.
Rejected Invalid DNS Update Message
DNS server successfully completed transfer of zone "$16" to DNS server at "$17"
DNS server successfully completed transfer of zone "$16" to DNS server at "$17"
DNS server aborted transfer of zone "$16" to DNS server at "$17"
DNS server aborted transfer of zone "$16" to DNS server at "$17"
DNS server received a zone transfer request from $15 for a non-existent or non-authoritative zone $16
DNS server received a zone transfer request from $15 for a non-existent or non-authoritative zone $16

FastPattern.description: ServiceWarning DNS server query fail with error (eventId 6268)

FastField.defaultValue: DNS server query failed with error code "$16" for "$15"
Global Query Block List is a feature that prevents attacks on your network by blocking DNS queries for specific host names
Query blocked by Global Query Block List
Zone transfer is in progress
New Version $15 of zone $16 found at DNS Server at $17
For more information see "To update the master server for a secondary zone" in the online Help. If available you can specify more than one master server in the list for this zone
Unable to connect to master DNS server at "$16" to receive zone transfer
Zone "$15" failed zone refresh check
Zone transfer request for secondary zone "$15" refused by master server at "$16"
Zone transfer request for secondary zone "$15" refused by master server at "$16"

The zone "$15" has been shut down
Failed transfer of zone "$15" from DNS server at "$16"
Check the DNS server at "$16" and ensure it is properly functioning and authoritative for zone "$15"
The DNS server at "$15" aborted or failed to complete transfer of the zone

FastPattern.description: ServiceInfo - updated its own host (A) records (eventId 6701)

FastField.defaultValue: In order to insure that its DS-integrated peer DNS servers are able to replicate with it, they have been updated with the new records through dynamic update.
DNS Server has updated its own host (A) records

FastPattern.description: ServiceInfo - error - updated its own host (A) records (eventId 6702)

FastField.defaultValue: In order to insure that its DS-integrated peer DNS servers are able to replicate with it, they have been updated with the new records through dynamic update. An error was encountered during this update, the record data is the error code.

If this DNS server does not have any DS-integrated peers, then this error should be ignored. If this DNS server's Active Directory replication partners do not have the correct IP address for this server, they will be unable to replicate with it.
DNS Server has attempted to update its own host (A) records, but an error occured
The DNS server recv() function failed
The DNS server recv() function failed
Domain name exceeding the maximum length in the packet from "$15"
The DNS server encountered a domain name exceeding the maximum length in the packet from $15. The event data contains the DNS packet

FastPattern.description: ServiceWarning: The DNS server could not open file (eventId 3152)

FastField.defaultValue: The file dns.log, usually located at "$15" is a DNS debug file.
The DNS server can not write to that file as it is opened by another process
The DNS server should never be sending a packet to itself. This situation usually indicates a configuration error.
DNS Server encountered a packet addresses to itself -- IP address $15

FastPattern.description: Packet name exceeding the maximum label (eventId 5508)

FastField.defaultValue: The DNS server encountered a packet name exceeding the maximum label count from "$15". The event data contains the DNS packet
The offset is the error
The DNS server encountered a packet name exceeding the maximum label count from "$15". The event data contains the DNS packet

FastPattern.description: ServiceWarning Packet DNS Server fails query (eventId 7600)

FastField.defaultValue: The global query block list is a feature that prevents attacks on your network by blocking DNS queries for specific host names. This feature has caused the DNS server to fail a query with error code NAME ERROR for "$15" even though data for this DNS name exists in the DNS database.

Other queries in all locally authoritative zones for other names that begin with labels in the block list will also fail, but no event will be logged when further queries are blocked until the DNS server service on this computer is restarted. See product documentation for information about this feature and instructions on how to configure it.

The DNS server has encountered numerous run-time events. These are usually caused by the reception of bad or unexpected packets, or from problems with excessive replication traffic. The data ($15) is the number of suppressed events encountered in the last 15 minute interval.
DNS Server Encountered Numerous Suppressed Events

The DNS server list of restricted interfaces does not contain a valid IP address for the server computer. The DNS server will use all IP interfaces on the machine.
The DNS server accept() function failed. The event data contains the error.
The DNS server accept() function failed. The event data contains the error.
